title: Art Instructor
description:
We highly value the contributions of experienced educators in our instructor community. Therefore, we require all applicants to:

  

  

*(1) showcase relevant teaching experience on your resume.*  

*(2) If you have a passion for education but lack formal teaching experience, please include a compelling cover letter explaining your interest in teaching and why you believe you would excel in an educational role.*


**About Togetherhood**
======================


Togetherhood is a marketplace for independent enrichment providers. We are a trusted source of consistently-outstanding enrichment experiences, across any topic, whether it be arts & crafts, skateboarding, breakdancing, performing arts with Broadway performers, STEM through the lens of Harry Potter or soccer with a former college athlete. We are a safe, secure community where children can experience the world around them, learn and, most importantly, have fun with their friends in programs led by other members of the community.Our mission is to enable consistently outstanding enrichment so that every one (regardless of their circumstances) has the opportunity to become who they aspire to be. We are focused on finding passionate, talented enrichment providers and giving them the autonomy and support they need to create engaging and magical experiences for children.

  

**What You'll Do**
==================


You will be matched with opportunities to teach art to elementary school students at schools, buildings and communities across the Bronx. These teaching opportunities will be for terms that could last anywhere from 6 weeks to 18 weeks. In this role, you'll have the following responsibilities:


* Conceive of and create an age-appropriate curriculum for your class
* Design outcome-based lesson plans
* Specify the materials you'll need to run the course successfully
* Consistently arrive at your class on time (or early!)
* Create and memorable experience for the children in your class to help them grow and develop a passion for art
* Help children understand why art is so wonderful and how it's helped shape you as a person


**Who You Are**
===============


* Fun, enthusiastic, experienced art instructor, with deep experience teaching school age children.
* Able to create positive class community and build relationships with students
* Experience leading your own classes
* Has excitement, joy and passion for teaching kids and personal development/learning
* Cooperative, supportive, flexible
* Has a strong work ethic and do whatever it takes mind set
* Clean background check and at least three references

title: Marketing Associate
description:
**Kings Bay Y / JCC Brooklyn** www.kingsbayy.org and www.jcc-brooklyn.org

**Marketing Associate**

**The opportunity:**


Join Our Creative Team as a Marketing Associate!


Are you ready to be a part of a dynamic and inspiring community space? At Kings Bay Y / JCC Brooklyn, we're all about connections, uplifting, and inspiring.Our inclusive environment embraces individuals from diverse religious, racial, and ethnic backgrounds. We offer an extensive range of programs tailored for children, families, and seniors. Our offerings include early childhood programs, dynamic summer day camps, after-school programs, aquatics and fitness programs, multiple social adult day care groups, teen and children’s programs as well as teen and Israel programs at 5 physical locations in Brooklyn.


As our Marketing associate, you'll play a pivotal role in crafting our online presence across multiple platforms. You'll collaborate with our robust team to bring our mission to life through eye-catching content, strategic campaigns, and meaningful engagement.

**Qualifications:**

* Preferred: 1 year of experience in a marketing-related field.
* Bachelor's Degree from an accredited institution preferred

**Skills:**

* A sense of humor, responsibility, and excellent communication skills.
* Proficiency in digital marketing tools (including but not limited to: Canva, Adobe, Microsoft Suite, CapCut) and social media platforms (i.e. Facebook/Meta, Instagram, YouTube).
* Excellent organizational skills.
* Creative thinking and problem-solving abilities.
* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Eagerness to learn and grow.
* Familiarity with Jewish culture and traditions is preferred but not required.

**Marketing Associate Responsibilities:**

* Work closely with the Marketing Supervisor and other marketing staff to develop and implement comprehensive marketing plans for various programs focusing on children and youth.
* Assist in creating engaging content for various platforms, including social media, email newsletters, and the Kings Bay Y/JCC Brooklyn website.
* Assist with special events
* Collaborate with program managers at various locations
* Monitor and analyze the performance of marketing campaigns and adjust strategies as needed
* Maintain and update marketing materials, ensuring consistency with Kings Bay Y/JCC Brooklyn branding guidelines.
* Support the development of program brochures, flyers, and other promotional materials.
* Engage with current and prospective families through regular communication and follow-ups, including but not limited to Facebook/Meta Messenger, Instagram DMs, emails.
* Stay current with industry trends and best practices to ensure Kings Bay Y/JCC Brooklyn marketing remains innovative and effective.

**Job Benefits:*** Health and vision coverage & dental coverage optional
* Pension Benefit plan, after one year, with agency contribution
* Life insurance, Optional 403/b plan & parental leave
* Generous Paid time off (PTO)
* Paid federal and additional holidays
* Employee program discounts

 **Schedule/Location:*** Full-time position in person based in our Sheepshead Bay, Brooklyn office

 **Salary:*** $50,000 to $60,000 commensurate with experience

**Mission Statement:**


Kings Bay YM-YWHA strives to build and strengthen communities, create meaningful relationships and lasting friendships, and foster deeper connections among individuals, families, and partner institutions in Brooklyn. From our flagship base in southern Brooklyn, where we operate a successful full-service community center, to our more recent inroads in Brownstone Brooklyn and North Brooklyn under the JCC Brooklyn umbrella, the Kings Bay Y has remained true to its 60-year-old mission.


To Apply : Send your resume to Tkzconsulting@kingsbayy.org

title: General Manager
description:
Description:

Arbor Lodging is a leading hotel investment and management company with a growing portfolio of hotels across the United States. We have been entrusted by numerous partners and are approved managers for Marriott, Hilton, Hyatt, and IHG. Our culture is focused on connecting our guests with exceptional experiences. We are people-focused, data-driven, and accountable—to our guests and our clients.

**Summary:**


The General Manager is responsible for all aspects of operations at the hotel, day-to-day staff management, and guest satisfaction. The GM should be an ambassador for the brand and the hotel, and provide leadership and strategic planning to all departments. The GM is responsible for managing an excellent guest experience and is required to manage between profitability and guest satisfaction measures.

  

Duties & Responsibilities:

* Is the model and example for maintaining a friendly, attentive, and service-oriented demeanor in all interactions with guests and hotel staff.
* Keeps open communication between leaders within the hotel staff and work to develop a high-quality staff that is aligned with the high level of guest service that is expected.
* Accurately manages financials, P&L, and payroll to maintain profitability.
* Ensures compliance with local and state requirements for licensing and permits.
* Maintains security and safety systems within the property and ensures that proper inspections and maintenance is attended to.
* Drives property-wide improvements within staff training and development to ensure top quality guest services and drive consistent guest returns.
* Maintains a professional working relationship and promotes open lines of communication with managers, employees and other departments.
* Communicates ideas, development goals, and tasks to team members effectively and maintains timely follow up to delegated tasks.
* Is able to keep a proactive view of issues within the property, and be attentive in arriving at a solution before the disruption of the hotel functions occurs.
* Creates analysis assessment of data and information from multiple sources to arrive at solutions that will be beneficial to the business.
* Receives concerns and issues from hotel guests and staff in an attentive, professionally-focused manner.
* Ability to effectively delegate tasks to the most qualified staff members.
* Ability to produce financial results in line with budgeted objectives.
* The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list; additional tasks may be assigned at any given time. The scope of the job may change as necessitated by business demands.


Requirements:

Qualifications:

* 3+ years in General Manager role required
* 1+ year brand experience required
* Select Service hotel experience preferred
* Bachelor’s degree from an accredited university in Hotel Management, Business Admin, or similar field is preferred
* Strong management skills of large teams
* Developed time management skills
* Proven ability to drive Guest Service Scores and profitability
* Prioritize multiple competing tasks


Benefits:

* Competitive salary
* Annual review with increase potential
* 401k program with company match
* Additional benefits may be available

**Arbor’s Guiding Principles:**


Arbor Lodging focuses on Five Guiding Principles to foster a culture where growth, development, and progression thrive within the properties:

* Do the Right Thing - Operate and act with integrity in all you do even when it is not convenient.
* Lead with Heart - Be kind, passionate and hospitable.
* Be Accountable - Take ownership and deliver results.
* Aim Higher - Go above and beyond to exceed expectations and pursue thoughtful change.
* Celebrate Differences - Embrace diversity; respect individual opinions and ideas.

*Arbor Lodging Management provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability or genetics. In addition to federal law requirements, Arbor Lodging Management complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities.*
company_addresses: 566 W. Lake Street, Suite 320 Chicago, IL 60661
company_description: At Arbor Lodging Management, our employees are essential to our success. We all strive to live by the Arbor Lodging Guiding Principles, which set the tone for how we treat each other and our guests.

title: Financial Lines Technical Officer, Global Specialty Claims
description:
Dir Claims FL - CV06EE
We’re determined to make a difference and are proud to be an insurance company that goes well beyond coverages and policies. Working here means having every opportunity to achieve your goals – and to help others accomplish theirs, too. Join our team as we help shape the future.  

Reporting to the Vice President, Financial Lines, the Financial Lines Technical Officer will manage a claims team handling Management Liability and Professional Liability Claims for Financial Services accounts. In addition, the role will be accountable for watch-list claims across D&O, Financial Services/Institutions and Pension Trust Liability. In connection with this subset of claims, this position will manage the watch lists, function as principal liaison with Financial Lines Underwriting/Actuarial teams for purposes of early flagging of new claims of interest, promotion of early identification/communication of coverage opportunities/gaps, identification of problem accounts, class-of-business issues, and jurisdictional developments. The person in this role will become a resource for better strategic discussions on risk exposure, driving settlements and ensuring that coverage positions are consistently mirroring efforts to resolve cases in a uniform manner.
Responsibilities include (but are not limited to):* Promote consistency in risk analysis and reserving approach, and the sharing of claims-trend and industry-trend information with Senior Business Line Management on a cross-Financial Lines portfolio basis.
* Efficient communication of jurisdictional nuances, event driven litigation, changes in controlling case law, regulatory and legislative changes, and judicial hellholes, to assist underwriting and claims in evaluating risks and drive profitability of the books of business.
* Adopt a unified approach to line-specific Large Loss trend analysis.
* Provide senior leadership with a guided view toward upcoming reserve increases on complex claims – act as “gatekeeper” on significant reserve increases.
* Active participant on roundtables within the Financial Lines claims discussions, as well as representative to Underwriting and Actuaries.
* Represent Financial Lines claims in discussions with Reinsurance partners during claims audits and treaty renewals.
* Ensure high quality claim handling with respect to coverage, liability and damages analysis, litigation management, negotiation strategy and effective resolution.
* Responsible for expense management and compliance with corporate claim standards and procedures, as well as all statutory, regulatory and ethics requirements.
* Effectively communicate and demonstrate a thorough understanding of business vision and strategies and develop plans for achieving business goals.
* Responsible for leading assigned projects and efforts in support of overall Global Specialty goals.


Qualifications:* Law degree preferred; four-year College Degree required
* 10+ years of experience in the Financial Lines claim space required (preferably in Financial Institutions and Services and/or Public D&O) with experience working on ‘bet the company’ litigation for insureds.
* Candidates are required to have knowledge and experience handling all aspects of Management and Professional Liability claims
* Ability to represent Hartford Global Specialty and our Insureds’ interest on driving settlements and negotiating allocations is required
* Knowledge of mediators and defense and plaintiff counsel is a plus
* Experience with or time in private law practice or with coverage law firms and/or other carriers is a plus
* Excellent oral and written communication skills
* Excellent negotiation, influencing, and advanced technical claim handling skills, including knowledge of insurance coverage issues in the Financial Lines context


This role can have a Hybrid or Remote work arrangement. Candidates who live near one of our office locations (Hartford, CT, San Antonio, TX, Lake Mary, FL, Phoenix, AZ, Naperville, IL) will have the expectation of working in an office 3 days a week (Tuesday through Thursday). Candidates who do not live near an office will have a remote work arrangement, with the expectation of coming into an office as business needs arise.
For full-time, occasional, part-time or remote positions: (1) high speed broadband internet service is required, we do not recommend or support DSL, wireless, Wi-Fi, Hotspots, Fiber without a modem and Satellite; (2) Internet provider supplied modem/router/gateway is hardwired to the Hartford issued computer with an ethernet cable; and (3) minimum upload/download speeds of 5Mbps/30Mbps will be required. To confirm whether your Internet system has sufficient speeds, please visit http://www.speedtest.net from your personal computer.
Compensation
The listed annualized base pay range is primarily based on analysis of similar positions in the external market. Actual base pay could vary and may be above or below the listed range based on factors including but not limited to performance, proficiency and demonstration of competencies required for the role. The base pay is just one component of The Hartford’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include short-term or annual bonuses, long-term incentives, and on-the-spot recognition. The annualized base pay range for this role is:
$146,560 - $219,840
Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity or Expression/Religion/Age

title: Data Scientist
description:
### **Basic Information**

Location
NY NY 100 W 33rd
Posted Date
01-Aug-2024
Agency
Solve(d)
Department
Data & Analytics
Job Number
43872
Job Type
Regular
Posting Locations
United States - New York, New York
Work Arrangement
Regular - Hybrid
### **Job Description**

**JOB SUMMARY**
As a Data Scientist, you will be responsible for collecting, analyzing, and interpreting large datasets to uncover insights and support decision-making. In this role, you will provide business and marketing insight to various stakeholders through analysis, research, and modeling and assist in the maintenance and enhancement of statistical models using open-source coding. You will also be expected to extract and analyze trends from customer databases, conduct multi-channel analysis, and prepare and deliver presentations to various levels of management. This position offers the opportunity to use your skills in advanced quantitative methods to drive business strategies and maximize ROI for our clients. **ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS**
Provide business insights through comprehensive analysis, integrate diverse data sources, apply advanced quantitative methods for customer segmentation, maintain statistical models with open-source coding, and utilize statistical/machine learning techniques to extract trends. Deliver presentations, analyze multi-channel data, aid real-time data flows, and optimize strategies through customer behavior analytics. **JOB DUTIES / RESPONSIBILITIES*** Provide business and marketing insight to various stakeholders through analysis, research and modeling;
* Integrate internal and external data sources, be comfortable working with structured data and be open to learning how to manage unstructured data;
* Assist in advanced quantitative methods to segment customers and healthcare practitioners (HCPs), and evaluate customer/HCP related activities for effectiveness and efficiency;
* Assist in the maintenance and enhancement of statistical models in R or Python (there is a preference for open-source coding);
* Use statistical and machine learning (ML) techniques to extract and analyze trends from the database / data warehouse;
* Prepare and deliver presentations with complex analytical concepts; and,
* Conduct multi-channel analysis for online and offline contexts using browsing and purchase data; assist in development and analysis of real-time data flows.
* Apply analytic techniques to customer or consumer behavior data to determine key customer insights, drive business strategies and maximize ROI

  

EDUCATION
DEGREE/DIPLOMA
AREA OF STUDY
REQUIRED/PREFERRED
Bachelor’s degree
Mathematics, Statistics, Economics, Computer Science, Engineering or other natural sciences
Bachelors - Required
Masters - Preferred
LICENSES & CERTIFICATIONS
EXPERIENCE
MINIMUM EXPERIENCE
AREA OF EXPERTISE
REQUIRED/PREFERRED
2+ years
Open-source Programming
Required
2+ yrs

Required
2+ yrs
Relational database management
Required
1+ yrs
Presenting and Presentation Building
Required
1+ yrs
Advertising or marketing industry work product
Preferred
1+ yrs
Healthcare industry work product
Preferred **KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS, & ABILITIES*** Hands-on experience using R or Python
* Hands-on experience using SQL (i.e. have an understanding of relational databases)
* Experience in applying advanced statistical and machine learning (ML) techniques
* Comfortable working with business partners and the ability to take initiative to drive projects forward
* Must be able to handle multiple projects from week to week
* Must have a strong interest in marketing and advertising
* Must have a strong interest in the healthcare industry
* Must have an eagerness to refine their presentation and communication skills
* Must have an interest in learning Tableau and PowerBI
* Comfortable presenting to upper management

 **COMPETENCIES*** Code Documentation
* Results Documentation
* Collegiality
* Problem solving
* Programming
* Data wrangling/cleaning
* Statistical analysis
* Adaptability

* Learning agility

 **Salary**
$65,000 to $80,000 annually
The salary range for this position is noted within this job posting. Where an employee or prospective employee is paid within this range will depend on, among other factors, actual ranges for current/former employees in the subject position; market considerations; budgetary considerations; tenure and standing with the company (applicable to current employees); as well as the employee’s/applicant’s background, pertinent experience, and qualifications.

title: NURSE PRACTITIONER
FACILITIES ASSISTANT
description:
**OUR VISION**
To continue as an eminent healthcare provider on Long Island, dedicating ourselves to providing exceptional health care for all our patients and to transform both the lives of the individual, and the community, for the better, one person at a time.

**OUR MISSION**


To provide access to equitable, optimal healthcare by improving the overall wellness of all individuals in our communities and delivering high quality comprehensive patient centered care.

**OUR VALUE PROPOSITION**


To provide whole person care that will ensure that all patients have access to primary, specialty and social health care to achieve and maintain optimal wellness at a transparent and affordable cost.


The Harmony Healthcare Long Island, formerly known as (Long Island Federally Qualified Health Center or LIFQHC) is a non-profit healthcare organization with 7 health centers, providing primary care and preventative medicine in the following locations in Nassau County: Roosevelt, Elmont, Hempstead, Freeport, Oceanside, and New Cassel/Westbury. In addition, the Harmony Healthcare Long Island has 3 school-based health centers, WIC offices (Special Supplemental Nutrition Program for Women, Infants, and Children) in 3 locations, and a Health Home Care Coordination program. As federally qualified health centers, we serve the individuals in our communities, providing enhanced services, expanded hours and reduced prescription pricing, while raising the level of care. We treat patients regardless of income, residency or immigration status.

  

The Harmony Healthcare Long Island offers a stable employment opportunity with a growing company, and competitive base compensation along with health and dental insurance, paid time off, 401-K with company match, paid holidays, employee discounts and much more.

**JOB TITLE:** Facilities Assistant


**REPORTS TO:** Facilities Manager

  

The following statements reflect the general duties, responsibilities and competencies considered necessary to perform the essential functions of the job and should not be considered as a detailed description of all the work requirements of this position.


RESPONSIBILITIES:

* Responsible for day-to-day facility maintenance & cleaning
* Responsible for the maintenance of structural surfaces
* Assist with general maintenance, to include painting and other light construction duties
* Participates in installation and maintenance of furnishings as directed
* Responsible for various building projects as directed
* Participates in any reconstruction or renovation as directed
* Assist Fire and Safety program as directed
* Arrange for meeting setup and refreshments as needed
* Monitor all work order requests logged through Track-it and ensure that appropriate action is taken within agreed timescales to ensure a high level of patient satisfaction
* Manage complaints received by Health Center to ensure that the Company's credibility with the customer is managed and where possible enhanced
* Assist in the management of facilities for all tenants in the building
* Carry out other projects and/or duties that may be assigned from time to time
* When needed, may help set up and wrap special events
* May be required to run various errands with in the health center radius
* Support facilities projects on a regular basis
* Delivers Results – takes accountability, ensuring productive, efficient execution against priorities
* Ability to work flexible schedule when necessary
* Prefer someone with a strong sense of their surroundings and good use of discretion

  

QUALIFICATIONS:

* High School Diploma or equivalent preferred
* 2+ years of experience in Facilities required
* Flexibility over working hours is essential for this role
* A willingness to change with the company requirements, and a desire to continually improve the services and facilities on offer
* Knowledge in using a computer and reports where interpretation is required
* A confident, warm and welcoming personality


SALARY: $18.00-$22.00/ hour


MORE INFORMATION: This is a non-exempt position.


The Harmony Healthcare Long Island provides equal employment opportunities to all qualified individuals without regard to race, creed, color, religion, national origin, age, gender, marital status, sexual preference and orientation, or non-disqualifying physical or mental handicap/disability in each aspect of the human resources function. Applicants as well as employees who are or become disabled must be able to perform the essential job functions either unaided or with reasonable accommodation. The Harmony Healthcare Long Island shall determine reasonable accommodation on a case-by-case basis in accordance with applicable law.

title: Payroll Administrator
description:
**Job Description**
-------------------


We are looking for a Payroll Administrator for this location! We are looking for a candidate with either a payroll or an accounting background, but we are willing to train the right person.


The Payroll Administrator is used to a fast-paced environment. He/she processes payroll using automotive payroll software with accuracy and efficiency. The Administrator must have strong attention to detail as well as problem solving and analytical skills and must be good with numbers. He/she is professional and dependable and can be trusted with sensitive information. The administrator ensures all personnel receive the correct compensation in a timely manner.


The ideal candidate has a degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration and at least two years of experience working in a payroll office. Experience with Paychex or similar payroll software is a plus. Candidates must have a working knowledge of relevant legal regulations and must be proficient with accounting software and with Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, and Outlook).


All candidates must pass a background and drug screening. All full-time employees are eligible for medical coverage after 90 days of employment.

**Responsibilities**

* Provides information and answers employee questions about payroll related matters
* Manages electronic timekeeping systems or manually collects and reviews timesheets
* Calculates payable hours, commissions, bonuses, tax withholdings, and deductions
* Prepares and issues earnings statements
* Issues paychecks and manages direct deposits
* Maintains employee records
* Maintains an orderly accounting system
* Processes weekly payroll for Union and Non-Union Employees
* Handles medical and dental benefits
* Handles all open enrollment procedures/forms, etc.
* Coordinates with the HR department to ensure correct employee data
* Provides administrative assistance to the accounting department
* Performs other responsibilities as assigned

**Qualifications**

* High school diploma or GED required; Degree in Business Administration, Accounting, or Finance highly preferred
* 2+ years of experience working in a payroll office
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office and payroll software programs
* Experience with Paychex or similar payroll software a plus
* Solid foundation of accounting fundamentals including open enrollment procedures/forms/Cobra
* Strong numerical aptitude and attention to detail
* Excellent communication skills, verbal and written
* Good time management and organizational skills
* Working knowledge of relevant legal regulations
* Able to prioritize and multitask effectively
* Able to deal with confidential information appropriately
* Strong data entry and management skills
* Strong attention to detail and interest in accuracy
* Strong problem solving and analytical skills
* Highly professional and dependable

**Benefits**
------------

* Health Insurance
* Dental Insurance
* Vision Insurance
* Sick Leave
* 401(k)
* Paid Time Off (PTO)
* Competitive Pay Plans
* Employee Discount purchase program
* Employee Assistance programs
* Employee Referral Program

**Company Description**
-----------------------

**WHY WORK FOR THE ATLANTIC AUTO GROUP?**  

  

**The Atlantic Automotive Group provides the best opportunity for any Long Islander who wants to launch a career in the auto industry.** Atlantic has locations all over Long Island. Atlantic brands include Genesis, Hyundai, Honda, Toyota, Kia, Chevrolet & Cadillac.  

  

With over 1200 employees, **Atlantic is clearly one of the major employers in Nassau and Suffolk Counties.** As Atlantic continues to add new locations, finding new employees is a major priority.  

  

**The group firmly believes in cultivating talent from within,** seeking out talented employees who can become Atlantic’s future managers. Factory training is offered to qualified employees seeking certification in sales, service, or parts. Each Atlantic location is like a small city that requires dedicated workers of varying skills and experience levels.  

  

Atlantic is renowned for offering new opportunities to people with some automotive experience, ambitious workers with skills from other businesses, veterans who have served their country, both men and women, and/or to people of all backgrounds, ages, races, and nationalities.  

  

**WE WELCOME VETERANS**  

  

We believe in the abilities of our military, and we’re actively recruiting them to the Atlantic Auto Group team. Hiring a veteran can be one of the best decisions a company can make. Military veterans are quick learners and they're team players. They are leaders with discipline, training, and a passion for service. We’re actively recruiting veterans, transitioning military, service members, and their families to bring these attributes to Atlantic and to help us build a better business.  

  

**OUR BENEFITS**


We currently offer discounted vehicle purchases to all employees and medical, dental, and vision, paid time off & sick leave as well as 401k benefits to our full-time employees who’ve met their eligibility requirements. With competitive pay plans, a 401k program, and Atlantic’s commitment to customer service, it’s no surprise that the Atlantic Auto Group is the eighth largest privately-owned car dealership group in the country.

 **We want to hire only the best, so all applicants must successfully pass a drug and background check and have a clean and valid NY State License.**

**Schedule 9 am - 5 pm Mon - Friday**
-------------------------------------


9 am - 5 pm Mon-Fri

title: Legal Regulatory Associate
description:
AIG is seeking a Legal Regulatory Associate to join the Group Regulatory Team of AIG’s GLCR Global Regulatory Group. Reporting to the Head of Group Regulatory, the successful candidate will support the strategies and activities of the Group in the areas of operations, process optimization, solutions development, and the ongoing support that Group Regulatory provides to US Regulatory. This position will regularly interact directly with senior management of the regulatory organization and as such be a key contributor to the effective and consistent execution of the Group’s responsibilities.
  
  

**Job Responsibilities:**  

Handle regulatory inquiries, exams and data collection exercises to satisfactory conclusions.
  
Manage information and documentation requests and facilitate meetings with regulators as required.
  
Help to ensure that documentation and responses are fulsome and adequately address the requests without exposing potential gaps or risks.
  
Identify and escalate key themes, potential risks and mitigation plans/strategy to proactively address key perceived risks before they become issues.
  
Perform efficient tracking, monitoring and disposition of all information requests and meetings from supervisory exams to ad hoc regulatory matters.
  
Support US Regulatory and Regulatory Operation as needed.
  
Work on other special projects and perform additional duties as required.
  
  

**Required Skills:**  

Strong Microsoft Office skills (Excel, PowerPoint and Word).
  
SharePoint experience preferred.
  
Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills.
  
Strong multitasking skills and easily adaptable to change.
  
Excellent attention to detail.
  
Strong analytical and process orientation with the ability to both validate existing processes as well as design future processes.
  
Robust problem-solving skills, including the ability to find multiple solutions to complex problems.
  
Appropriate assertiveness and sense of urgency.
  
Proactive and self-motivated with the ability to work independently.
  
Collaborative and helpful.
  
  

**Education & Experience:**  

Bachelor’s degree preferred.
  
  

3+ years in a large financial services organization; insurance or insurance-related experience is a plus
  
  

For positions based in Jersey City, the base salary range is $88,000 - $96,000. For positions based in NYC, the base salary range is $89,000 - $98,000. In addition, the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. title: IT Risk and Controls Manager
description:
At AIG, we are reimagining the way we help customers to manage risk. Join us as a IT Risk and Controls Manager to play your part in that transformation. It’s an opportunity to grow your skills and experience as a valued member of the team.
  
  

Make you mark in Information Technology
  
  

At AIG, technology is at the heart of everything we do, from underwriting risks to processing claims. The Information Technology team equips our colleagues with the latest tools to complete their work efficiently and with the highest standards of excellence. The team is responsible for shielding the company’s systems from security risks, while designing technology strategies that enable AIG’s businesses to achieve their goals. AIG’s Information Technology functions include enterprise architecture, software and systems engineering, cybersecurity, and technology risk and compliance.
  
  

How you will create an impact
  
  

This role is within the Technology, Risk and Controls organization with a focus on SOX and SOC1. The ideal candidate will will drive control effectiveness through overseeing SOX and SOC1 audit, analyzing transformation risk on SOX controls, designing effective controls, remediation governance and timely escalation. Candidate will be working with IT Stakeholders & Management, Information Security, Internal Auditors, External Auditors, Legal and others to maintain AIG’s IT controls within our risk appetite.
  
  

Responsibilities
  
  

Oversee SOX and SOC1 audit over General Insurance IT controls to ensure right stakeholders are engaged, audit requests are responded to timely and accurately and any potential issues are reported to AIG management timely
  
Work with IT to enhance current controls, define new controls and outline impact to SOX IT controls due to major transformations
  
Monitor operation of key controls to ensure annual SOX and SOC 1 timelines are met and there are minimal issues
  
Track and Report on status of self-identified issues, open audit findings and remediation plans. Assist IT teams with remediation activities as needed.
  
Interact with Internal Audit and External Audit for various audits and ensure audit scope is clearly understood, audit escalations are managed effectively and proper audit is provided on any issues noted
  
  

What you'll need to succeed
  
  

Bachelor’s degree in business, Information Systems, or a related field; master's degree preferred.
  
7+ years of experience within IT audit or Risk Management or Internal Controls specializing in SOX or SOC1 audits. Big 4 and/or Financial Services Internal Audit Experience preferred
  
Thorough understanding of the audit process, control testing, designing new controls, leading remediation efforts, writing audit responses and SOX regulation
  
Solid understanding of IT and Security concepts, emerging technologies and associated risk
  
Certified Information Systems Auditor (CISA) or Certified in Risk and Information Systems Control (CRISC).
  
Good communication, presentation, and interpersonal skills.
  
Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities, with keen attention to detail.
  
  

Ready to prove your potential? We would love to hear from you.
  
  

For positions based in Jersey City, NJ, the base salary range is $99,000-$143,000 and the position is eligible for a bonus in accordance with the terms of the applicable incentive plan. In addition, we’re proud to offer a range of competitive benefits, a summary of which can be viewed here: New\\_Hire\\_Benefits\\_Overview\\_202.pdf (sprinklr.com)

title: Manager, Statutory Reporting
description:
Reporting to the Director, Statutory Controller, this role is primarily responsible for delivery of quarterly/annual statement regulatory reporting for AIG’s US-domiciled P&C insurance companies. Specifically, the Manager, Statutory Reporting is primarily responsible for supervising the preparation and executing review of all required insurance technical reporting submissions within these filings, including underwriting exhibits with detail of activity by line of business, location of risk, etc. Additionally, the Manager will lead coordination across disciplines within Finance to ensure timely and accurate delivery of schedules and exhibits related to reinsurance, loss reserves, investments, etc.
  
  

**Key Responsibilities:**  

Lead the supervision and review of a team of onshore and offshore resources through the production of all required exhibits and schedules contained within the quarterly/annual statements of 18 US-domiciled P&C insurance companies; this will include reporting produced by the Manager’s own team as well as specialists across disciplines
  
Support production and review of other required filings across all companies and all state insurance departments
  
Ensure timely and effective execution of all relevant internal controls supporting the statutory financials, including data governance, transactional controls, key reconciliations and analytical reviews
  
Support the Statutory Controllership throughout the quarterly financial close process, through collaboration with internal stakeholders
  
Support ongoing strategic development and execution/validation of finance transformation projects; fully leverage capabilities of new Finance architecture to drive expected improvement in timeliness of reporting and depth of analytical insights
  
Develop responses to inquiries from state insurance departments, ratings agencies, and analyst inquiries regarding reported results with input from various internal stakeholders
  
Identify, recommend and implement process improvements with a particular focus on enhancing the use of technology and development of automated solutions to drive efficiency in the quarterly close
  
Foster a culture of continuous improvement, accountability to self and team
  
  

**Qualifications:**  

Bachelor’s degree in accounting, CPA a plus
  
5+ years of relevant professional experience, particularly leading teams in a controllership or financial reporting capacity for a P&C insurance company
  
Statuatory experience as well as insurance industry experience required.
  
Strong technical accounting experience with P&C insurance companies, with an ability to connect business and accounting outcomes through reported financial results
  
Possessing a well-balanced approach to hands-on support and detailed review of team-produced reporting, with a big picture view of the insurance companies’ results to ensure accuracy of regulatory filings
  
Systems-technical acumen, able to quickly grasp management reporting structures, understand a newly transformed finance architecture and financial reporting platform, and determine how to extract maximum value in execution of financial reporting requirements
  
Strong interpersonal skills and an ability to communicate and collaborate effectively with individuals across Finance and operational disciplines towards a common purpose
  
Experience leading teams in a dynamic, transformational environment, where change is embraced and viewed as an opportunity to drive process improvement
  
Proven people manager with strong ability to develop teams in both on and offshore locations
  
10% travel required
  
  

#LI-CY

title: Brand Manager, Strategy & Core Innovation
description:
**Brand Manager, Strategy & Core Innovation**
=============================================


As a key member of a team with exciting growth goals in the exciting wellbeing drinks category, you will be inspired to bring strategic solutions & executional excellence in a collaborative environment. **PURPOSE**
Continuously grow the Twinings Brand through strategic thought leadership which leverages consumer insights, brand fundamentals and commercial knowledge.  

With effective leadership of brand management and portfolio strategy, this role is highly influential - ensuring consumer-centric, sustainable brand growth.  

This is a people leadership role charged with developing a direct report and inspiring them and others to be at their best. **CONTEXT**
Twinings North America (US and Canada) has been identified as a strategic focus for global growth and our focus is to double the size of our business in the next five years, operating within the exciting wellbeing drinks category.  

Twinings is a uniquely decentralized business that operates with local autonomy supported by a global Marketing Excellence team. This allows for local consumer centricity and decision making, backed by a global powerhouse that includes global support of our digital transformation.  

We are culturally in sync with our brand ethos of being a vibrant, wellbeing drinks brand. We are a vibrant and collaborative team that operates with a ‘one team’ mentality, valuing collaboration, ethical integrity, and a motivation for winning. **SCOPE**
You will be an integral part of our Marketing team, building short-term & long-term strategies, owning end to end plans, and supporting the day-to-day management of the Twinings Brand portfolio. Serving as the lead on brand management and portfolio strategy across both the US and Canada, you will be responsible for ongoing portfolio strategy and brand management, inclusive of brand performance tracking and analysis, delivering business situation assessments, renovation of core portfolio, SKU prioritization & rationalization, assisting with the creation of 5-year strategic business planning and annual operating plans, and partnering with sales on retail strategy and sell-in.  

Reporting into the Director of Brand Strategy & Insights, this role is highly collaborative and will work closely across total TNA, including our Sales, Finance, Innovation, Connections and Global Twinings teams. It is expected that this role will build trusting working relationships with cross functional partners and senior stakeholders as well as tap into the wider organization to learn and leverage best practices from around the Twinings group to deliver significant growth in line with the investment-level spending to build the brand. In addition, you are responsible for managing and developing one direct report. **ACCOUNTABILTIIES**
Portfolio & Brand Management* Oversee the execution of the Brand Planning Process and deliver Business Situation Assessments by leveraging consumer, customer, and category insights to assist in the development of the 5-year Strategic Business Plan and Annual Operating Plans to deliver on short- and long-term brand growth targets for equity, market share, net sales, and profit.
* Direct cross-functional team to deliver equity-building core business innovation projects from concept through commercialization.
* Establish and promote best practices to track and analyze in-market business performance of core business and NPD in partnership with Marketing, Insights and Sales teams. Develop data-driven, actionable recommendations for on-going portfolio management.
* Identify white space opportunities within North American market to optimize and accelerate the Twinings brand equity and market share across product and packaging offerings.
* Lead price/pack architecture, SKU prioritization, and SKU rationalization.
* Partner with Insights team on brand performance metrics, Segmentation, Need states Framework, and other projects to provide strategic input, facilitate key insights-led decisions, and embed in consumer-led brand strategies.
* Actively contribute to and craft compelling retail customer sell-in stories.

  

Leadership* Manage and develop one direct report, with a focus on providing them the tools to thrive professionally and develop junior marketing talent.
* Cultivate Twinings brand passion in other by being an inspirational brand ambassador.
* Be an active role model of the “One Team” mindset, establishing and fostering highly collaborative team relationships.
* Actively contribute to the global marketing community to share and gain learning.

 **EXPERIENCE REQUIRED*** Demonstrated experience with developing and executing short- and long-term brand growth strategies and plans.
* Experience leading innovation projects from concept through commercialization.
* Comprehensive analytical and critical thinking skills. Proficient in leveraging and analyzing syndicated POS and Panel data sources (i.e. Nielsen, IRI, Numerator) and have an in-depth understanding of qualitative and quantitative consumer insights and trends with the ability to turn insights into action.
* Exceptional storyteller and influential communicator with demonstrated ability to distill data into actionable insights to craft a compelling story that inspires a call to action among senior leaders and retailers.
* A proactive, solution-oriented, creative problem-solver with the ability to thrive in a highly collaborative entrepreneurial-minded environment.
* Advanced project management skills, previous experience with leading complex projects with multiple senior stakeholders.
* Strong business insight coupled with an insatiable consumer curiosity and a motivation for driving consumer centricity throughout the organization.
* Engaging People Manager with the ability to manage and develop a direct report.
* Experience in working within FMCG/CPG in a fast-paced & collaborative environment.
* Advanced PowerPoint and Excel skills

  

Our Twinings Values  

Aim high  

* Strive to deliver results of which they can be truly proud;
* Relentlessly seek to improve ideas and plans;
* See the potential in situations; often where others do not;
* Respect intuition and experience, as well as hard data;
* Demonstrate rigour and discipline in their thinking, planning and execution;
* Always do what they say they will do.

  

Freedom to act and scope for growth  

* Have genuine respect for the views, talents and expertise of colleagues; trust in their motivation, believe in them to get the job done;
* Take responsibility, make things happen, and seize the initiative;
* Learn from their mistakes;
* Take responsibility for their own development, and help others grow.
  

Find new ways  

* Are willing to experiment; take calculated risks and challenge the status quo;
* Seek or create the best solutions; find creative ways around road blocks;
* Thrive in a changing, often ambiguous environment;
* Show agility and adaptability.

  

Look outside  

* Learn from other business units, markets, competitors, customers and consumers;
* Look to other industries and a wide range of data sources for ideas and inspiration;
* Show active interest in other teams; are happy to take others' ideas and build on them.

  

Collaborate  

* Go out of their way to help each other to be successful and share information freely;
* Seek others' inputs and challenges; openly share their own views;
* Work freely across the organization's hierarchy and structure;
* Work to ensure that one plus one is three or more;
* Give constructive, challenging, straight, forward and timely feedback.

title: Accounts Payable Processor - Part Time
description:
Mineola, NY (fully on-site)

 **About Us:**


Hanover Bank, The Bank of YOU – When you love your work and the people you work with, careers are made!


Embracing diversity, valuing inclusion and showing respect are the foundation upon which we build our team. At Hanover Bank, inclusion means respecting personal beliefs and appreciating that we all have perspectives that matter. We are stronger together as we move toward a shared vision of personal and corporate growth.


Whether you are just starting out or a seasoned professional, working for Hanover Bank can launch you on a path to success. With a passion for excellence, we strive to deliver exceptional service to our clients, foster a positive impact in the communities in which we work and live and help our team members achieve their professional goals.


When you work with us you are empowered, engaged and encouraged to collaborate because every voice matters, every person counts!

**Job Summary:**


Hanover Bank is looking for a part-time Accounts Payable Processor. Under direct supervision of the Accounts Payable Specialist, the AP Associate is responsible for a variety of functions related to the Company’s Accounts Payable process.


This position offers a flexible work schedule within the following parameters: 25 hours per week between the hours of 8:30 a.m. - 5:15 p.m. Monday-Friday, so long as the schedule remains consistent.

**Job Duties and Responsibilities:**

* Maintain the integrity of the Bank’s Accounts Payable System.
* Create and maintain vendor information; obtain onboarding info such as W-9, OFAC, and ACH information.
* Input invoices and other payables into the accounts payable system.
* Determine and assign the appropriate general ledger account number and description to incoming invoices and verify appropriate sales and use tax for each location.
* Verify all invoices submitted for payment are properly approved with the appropriate level of authorization and documentation necessary to process in accordance with bank policy before processing final payment.
* Research and resolve monthly vendor statements and invoice discrepancies.
* Ensure invoices of thirty days or more are verified for previous payment.
* Process Transaction Manager in Prologue when processing checks.
* Process and mail AP checks timely.
* Process ACH payments.
* Address inquiries from vendors and/or Hanover Bank’s departments regarding past-due invoices and/or paid invoices.
* Other tasks as assigned.

**Professional Requirements:**

* Minimum of 1-3 years related work experience in accounts payable.
* Accounting background preferred.

**Skills and Abilities:**

* Strong PC skills (spreadsheets and word processing).
* Good oral and written communication skills.
* Strong attention to detail.
* Commitment to accuracy, integrity, and ethical behavior at all times.
* Willingness to learn.
* Ability to handle a large volume of invoices.

 **Our Benefits:**

* Medical, Dental and Vision (including HSA, FSA & Commuter Benefits)
* Company-paid benefits to include life insurance and AD&D plus long-term disability
* Voluntary Benefits (including additional life insurance and AD&D insurance for yourself, your spouse and/or your dependent children, Voluntary Short-Term Disability, Pet Insurance and Legal Services)
* Supplemental Health Benefits (including Accident insurance, Hospital indemnity insurance and Cancer Care)
* Retirement-401(k) with Company Match
* Paid Personal Time Off (PTO) & Paid Company Holidays
* Annual Bonuses
* Annual Increases
* Employee Events and Contests
* ***As a part-time employee, you may not be eligible for all of the above benefits.***

***Hourly Rate: $20.00 - $23.00***; placement within this range will vary based on experience and skill level.

**Hanover Bank is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or protected veteran status.**

title: Inventory Specialist
description:
**About Ocean Power Technologies:**
A pioneer in ocean-energy technology, Ocean Power Technologies' (OPT) sustainable power generation and data capabilities with low- and no-carbon solutions allow for smarter and faster actionable insights as ocean operations become increasingly digitized. OPT provides intelligent maritime solutions and services that enable safer and more productive ocean operations for the defense and security, oil and gas, science and research, and offshore wind markets. OPT is headquartered in New Jersey, with offices and facilities in Richmond, CA. To learn more, visit www.oceanpowertechnologies.com. **About the Role:**
The Inventory Specialist is expected to work in a multi-disciplinary team environment with highly qualified professionals. As such, he/she drives customer project and product development program execution needs specific to material requirements planning. Work with peers, management, and other departments to advance the business mission.* **Inventory Management**: Oversee the daily in and out management of inventory. Ensure that Stock levels are accurate with spot checks for accuracy done often.
* **Data Analysis**: Analyze our current stock to define trends, patterns and discrepancies (Understand how to make informed decisions around ordering and stock levels)
* **Demand Forecasting**: Predict future inventory needs based on historical data, market trends, and sales forecasts.
* **Order Processing**: Manage and process purchase orders in a way that ensures a timely replenishment of inventory to keep up with the flow of planned production timelines.
* **Stock Audits**: Conduct regular interval stock audits and reconcile them within the MRP system inventory module.
* **Supply Chain Coordination**: Work closely with team-members onsite, offsite, suppliers, manufacturers, and logistics partners to ensure smooth and timely delivery of goods for both internal transfers as well outgoing and incoming shipments. Understand how to flow inventory based on ancillary services that require shipping as well as production (Raw Material -> WIP -> SFG)
* **Report Generation**: Know how to prepare reports built on KPIs that help gauge Inventory Health for management.
* **System Maintenance**: Maintain and update Inventory within the MRP system, always ensuring data integrity and accuracy.
* **Cost Control**: Monitor and control inventory costs, including consideration of storage, ordering, and carrying costs both near and long term.
* **Process Improvement**: Identify and implement process improvements to enhance inventory management efficiency and accuracy.
* **Compliance**: Ensure that inventory practices comply with company policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
* **Training and Support**: Provide training and support to staff involved in inventory management processes.
* **Logistics** – Managing shipping and receiving of incoming and outgoing materials

 **Requirements:*** An associates degree or equivalent experience in a related field.
* Experience in a Material Requirements Planning (MRP) system.
* Demonstrated track record of inventory management, reporting, and auditing existing stock levels.
* Demonstrated track record of leadership, accountability, and ownership
* Software Capability- MS Office, MRP System (Odoo preferred).

title: DIRECT SUPPORT PROFESSIONAL (DSP)
description:

URGENTLY SEEKING TO HIRE

title: Packer/Palletizer
description:
The **Packer / Palletizer** is an associate that is responsible for a multitude of job responsibilities within the packaging area of each production.

**​​​​​​​Duties & Responsibilities**

* Accurately and efficiently pack product into appropriate box.
* Safety and effectively operate labelers and print appliers.
* Safely remove product from the line and replace product onto the line when necessary.
* Safely run trash compactor and card board bailor.
* Adhere to the company’s Good Manufacturing Practices (GMPs) and the general food safety standards of BRC.
* Perform spot checks on products to ensure adherence to approved quality standards.
* Responsible for routine cleaning and general maintenance of the workspace as assigned.
* Notify supervisor of product discrepancies and/or equipment malfunctions.
* Clean and sanitize the production line when the production schedule warrants a line clean.
* Adhere to established company policies and procedures regarding plant safety.
* Perform other related duties as assigned, alerting team leaders and managers of idle time.
* Adhere to all company polices including but not limited to break times, safety regulations, attendance, and harassment.
* Additional job duties as required.

**Working conditions & Physical Requirements**

* Must be able to work standing for up to eight (8) hours per day.
* Saturday work may be required.
* Working knowledge of key safety disciplines, such as LOTO, PPE, and machine guarding.
* Must be able to lift up to 50lbs regularly.
* Must be able to bend, stoop, twist and turn regularly.
* Ability to regularly use ladders and stairs.
* Employee Must Adhere to ALL Plant Safety Policies and Procedures.
* Proper Lock-Out, Tag-Out (LOTO) observance is always required.
* Non-slip rubber sole shoes to be worn while on the shop floor.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $16.15 per hour

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift

Shift availability:

* Overnight Shift (Required)

Work Location: In person

title: Director of IT Systems Administration
description:
Description:

The Director of IT Systems Administration will set the direction for the management of information technology throughout the organization, including collaborating with senior leadership on aligning IT capabilities with the business strategy. The Director of IT Systems Administration is responsible for developing the network infrastructure and platform to deliver services, maintenance of business relationships with vendors, budget setting and budget-to-actual tracking, project delivery, security monitoring to ensure compliance with all SOC controls and the management of the company’s disaster recovery. With deep experience implementing systems that enable business growth and scalability the Director of IT Systems Administration collaborates with Business Unit leaders to develop and execute a strategy to ensure a technical infrastructure that can grow with the company’s business needs. The Director of IT Systems Administration will stay current on technological advances and set the direction for their team including the definition of roles and responsibilities, structure, processes.

**Primary Responsibilities**

* As a key partner to the business, The Director of IT Systems Administration collaborates closely with business units, operations, finance, program management, and analytics teams to ensure that the company employs the right IT systems and tools and that they operate efficiently and effectively in support of corporate goals.
* Owns, leads, and manages all stages of the development of Verus’ new applications, including management of processes, systems, tools, vendors, and their performance. Demonstrated strong leadership and execution enables the Director of IT Systems Administration to drive the development to conclusion, managing all aspects of the project within allocated budgets and time.
* Serves as systems administrator for legacy platform(s) and works with Business Unit leaders to manage legacy platform performance. Leads migration to/integration with new applications.
* As the technical owner of the company’s CRM system (Salesforce.com), The Director of IT Systems Administration will be responsible for the maintenance of the system including gathering of business requirements, translating them into new systems and processes, and maintaining system reliability and data integrity. Serves as system administrator for Verus LLC’s Salesforce.com environment, while ensuring optimal performance through regular upgrades and internal system audits.
* Collaborates with CEO, CSO and Business Unit leaders to plan for integration of platforms of any new acquisition targets. Leads IT part of M&A due diligence.
* Works collaboratively with internal stakeholders and helps translate business requirements into technical designs; defines technical solutions to support business work processes and brings the design to life in Salesforce.com and related tools.
* Works with all required resources to troubleshoot IT system issues and demonstrates the ability to drive to a successful resolution for all stakeholders.
* Owns and manages Verus’ hardware and software infrastructure; optimizes both constantly to maximize company efficiency while minimizing company costs.
* Supports Sales, Business unit leaders and CEO/CSO in customer-facing meetings to demonstrate and enhance the value proposition of Verus’ IT applications and processes.

**Strategy, Planning, Innovation & Transparency**

* Collaborates with CEO, CSO and business unit leaders to create strategic plans for the business’ future growth.
* Advises and participates in strategy meetings to develop and implement new technologies.
* Stays current on IT technology, such as the emergence of AI.
* Ensures all statistics regarding department performance are accurately gathered, maintained, and reported.
* Establishes, maintains, and manages budget and capital expense reporting.

**Organization & Vendor Management**

* Sets the direction, optimizes the team, and leads department staff, following the model of empowerment, delegation, and accountability.
* Effectively manages multiple projects including capitalization, providing direction on the integration of technology infrastructure, user support, administrative systems, and external access.
* Effectively manages department resources to ensure optimum allocation and utilization of technology and systems.
* Develops and maintains service-level specifications (KPIs) and effective business relationships with IT vendors to ensure not only the best technology solutions are available, but also optimizes financial arrangements to the benefit of the company.
* Develops KPIs and SLAs to track and manage IT vendor performance.

**Collaboration Platforms, Connectivity, Operations & Security**

* Develops a strategy to ensure Information Technology Applications and Infrastructure can grow with the Company needs, including data security, network infrastructure, server infrastructure and storage.
* Develops operation and maintenance plans including production support.
* Partners with leadership team to develop and maintain a Disaster Recovery Plan for data, hardware, and the continuity of Information Technology in the event of a business interruption. Develops and maintains business continuity plan (BCP) for IT infrastructure.
* Partners with business team to identify, monitor and report on SOC audit controls when needed.
* Ensures that the Company’s IT operations adhere to federal, state, and local laws and regulations and manages vendor licensing requirements.


Requirements:
* Master’s degree in information systems, business, or related field preferred, or combination of bachelor’s degree with related tenure and experience.
* Minimum 3+ years of experience in CRM administration in a complex, high-growth B2B environment, Salesforce knowledge a plus.
* 10+ years of operational IT management experience.
* Demonstrated ability to lead and manage high-performing teams.
* Demonstrated ability to manage and execute complex development projects, driving those to completion within the budgeted cost and timeline parameters.
* Ability to assess the impact of new requirements on Salesforce.com and all upstream and downstream applications, systems, and processes.
* Excellent knowledge of IT systems and infrastructure.
* Solid understanding of data analysis, budgeting, and business operations.
* Experience working in the claims processing arena a plus.
* Demonstrated excellence in the following areas:

	+ Strong, demonstrated leadership of IT business, IT teams, and external vendors (onshore and offshore).

	+ Change management experience with proven track record of leading and implementing complex IT systems and applications, delivered on time and within budget.

	+ Demonstrated ability to build and lead a high-performing team, maximizing their ability to perform.

	+ Excellent communication skills which include translating technical details into business language for business stakeholders to maximize effectiveness and collaboration.

	+ Demonstrated ability to design, plan, and implement systems and IT processes that enable business growth and scalability.

	+ Track recording of designing, planning, and implementing systems and IT processes to enable business processes.

	+ Strong business and financial acumen. Understanding of financial concepts, budgeting, planning, and cost management.

	+ Exhibits strong results/execution-driven behaviors. Manages deadlines and expectations through strong execution and effective communication.

**Working Conditions**


Working conditions are normal for an office environment. This is primarily an in-office role which includes the occasional evening or weekend work as business needs may require.

**Travel**


Travel is primarily local during the business day, although if needed, the occasional out-of-the-area and overnight travel may be expected.

title: ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE COORDINATOR
company: TFP1 Inc dba Total Fire Protection Inc
description:
At Total Fire Protection, our **MISSION** is simple, **“Embracing Relationships, while keeping you safe, and delivering First Class Service.”** You won’t just be a team member at Total Fire Protection, but a valuable contributor. Our diverse team members support one another as we work towards our common goal of bringing Fire and Life Safety to our customers nationwide.

  

Our Company culture has been built on the foundation of our **CORE VALUES** that define **“Who We Are”** and we hold each other accountable to these **CORE VALUES.** Our ***Five-Alarm Growth*** represents our commitment to embracing change, evolutionary action, continuous learning, constant improvement and full engagement. We place the priorities of our ***Team First*** and our team members back it up through ***Do What You Say!*** execution. Total Fire Protection believes that ***Do the Right Thing!*** builds loyalty, trust and respect because ***We Care*** about our team members, our customers and our community.

 **The Accounts Receivable Coordinator** is responsible for ensuring the integrity of the Company's accounting information by collecting payments from clients and assisting in the overall responsibilities of the accounting department.

 **Responsibilities:**

  

* Solid understanding of Accounts Receivable (AR)
* Manage accounts receivable portfolio of assigned accounts.
* Assisted in setting up payment plans; contacted clients to help resolve payment issues.
* Perform various basic accounting tasks by standard procedures, including general accounting tasks.
* Promote, communicate, and reinforce the organization's mission, values, and culture.
* Provide information, as requested, by customers, the sales department, and other stakeholders.
* Identify delinquent customer accounts through various means, e.g., written correspondence, phone contact, USPS mail, and making payment arrangements.
* Excellent attention to detail
* Attend meetings with the sales department to review risk accounts and resolve issues.
* Prepare various accounts receivable reports and analyses.
* Develop and maintain strong customer relations.
* Experience navigating customer websites and portals if needed.
* Serve as the sole owner of the Accounts Receivable processes and act as the primary contact for all Accounts Receivable related questions, keeping appropriate parties updated and informed.
* Request funding updates from all clients for monthly open billings and follow up weekly for overdue payments.
* Attend AR meetings with Project Managers to discuss collections or any billing revisions needed.
* Communicate bi-weekly AR meeting updates with any discrepancies to the management team, identify slow-paying clients, and recommend collection candidates.
* Submit necessary lien waivers to clients for payments received.
* Collect Unconditional Final Lien Waivers from customers to complete close-out packages and obtain final client payment.


 Other duties as assigned\\*

 **Requirements:**

* **Command of Microsoft Office with strong Excel skills**
* **AA or BS/BA degree in Business Administration or related field preferred**
* **Demonstrated analytical skills in basic accounts receivable and accounting policy.**
* **Efficient in ERP systems**
* **2+ years of relevant experience in accounts receivable**

  

Think you have what it takes to be a Total Fire Protection team member? Apply to be a part of this dynamic organization!

  

Total Fire Protection is an Equal Opportunity Employer and does not discriminate against any applicant based on race, color, religion, national origin, gender, marital status, age, disability, sexual orientation, military/veteran status, or any other status protected by Federal or State law or local ordinance.

title: Physical Therapy Aide
description:
Position Summary:


Our Therapy Aides are valued members of our clinic team. They ensure the equipment and clinic remain safe and clean for our patients, provide support to our front office team such as answering phones, collecting copays, checking in patients, and communicating with the patients and their family members. This is a great opportunity for students who are pursuing exercise science, physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy or anyone who loves being in healthcare and helping others.
Join Ivy Rehab’s dedicated team where you’re not just an employee, but a valued teammate! Together, we provide world-class care in physical therapy, occupational therapy, speech therapy, and applied behavior analysis (ABA) services. Our culture promotes authenticity, inclusion, growth, community, and a passion for exceptional care for every patient.


Job Description:

**P****hysical Therapy Aide**


Ivy Rehab Network


Why Choose Ivy?

* **Best Employer:** A prestigious honor to be recognized by Modern Healthcare, signifying excellence in our industry and providing an outstanding workplace culture.
* **Innovative** **Resources & Mentorship:** Access to abundant resources, robust mentorship, and career advice for unparalleled success.
* **Professional Development:** Endless opportunities for career advancement through training programs centered on administrative excellence and leadership development.
* **Exceeding Expectations:** Deliver best-in-class care and witness exceptional patient outcomes.
* **Incentives Galore:** Eligibility for full benefits package beginning within your first month of employment. Generous PTO (Paid Time Off) plans, paid holidays, and bonus incentive opportunities.
* **Exceptional Partnerships:** Collaborate with leaders like Hospital for Special Surgery (HSS) to strive for excellence in patient care.
* **Empowering Values:** Live by values that prioritize teamwork, growth, and serving others.
  

 Position Qualifications:

* Ability to work in a fast-paced environment while maintaining a positive attitude.
* Exceptional written and verbal communication skills and bedside manner.
* Outstanding time management and ability to multi-task.
* Proven exceptional customer service and patient care experience.
* Self-motivated with the drive to exceed patient expectations.
* Flexibility to work varied shifts and possible weekends.
*We are an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion in all aspects of the recruiting and employment process. Actual salaries depend on a variety of factors, including experience, specialty, education, and organizational need. Any listed salary range or contractual rate does not include bonuses/incentive, differential pay, or other forms of compensation or benefits.*

title: Teacher Assistant
description:
**Find your passion!**

**This position is part of ACP Early Intervention, a division of Autism Care Partners.** ACP Early Intervention is looking for friendly faces, positive attitudes, and playful personalities to bring our services to life. We offer opportunities for individuals at all stages of their careers the opportunity to join a team of like-minded individuals who are passionate about changing the lives of the children and families we serve. Come grow with us!

**What do we offer Full-Time Teacher Assistants?**

* Health Insurance/Dental/Vision
* Health Savings Account (HSA)
* Paid Time Off
* Life Insurance
* 401(K) Matching
* Referral Program
* Others

**What you’ll be doing at Autism Care Partners:**


ACP Early Intervention is looking for a Teacher Assistant at our Bronx Center! Are you passionate about making a difference in the lives of children with disabilities and children on the Autism Spectrum? Then come and join our team of dedicated professionals!

*Teacher Assistant* will work under the direct supervision of a Head Classroom Teacher and will be part of a multi-disciplinary team while providing 1:1 instruction in a classroom setting with children ranging from 18 months to 3 years of age.

* Arrive on time and prepare for daily sessions
* Work collaboratively with a Head Classroom Teacher & Educational Director to implement basic principles and teaching procedures of ABA
* Collect behavior and skill acquisition data during sessions
* Complete the session notes immediately after the session
* Be responsive to the needs and requests of students, their families, and their supervisor
* Attend Professional Development Training, as required
* Be goal-oriented and maintain professionalism in all aspects of your work
* The ability to physically lift up to 50 lbs.

**Qualifications**

* A high school diploma or equivalent; a college student pursuing a degree in one of the following fields is preferred: Early Childhood Education/ Special Education, Psychology, Behavioral Science, Human Services, Applied Behavioral Analysis (ABA)
* Experience working with children with developmental delays or in an early childhood setting preferred
* Ability to work closely with children between the ages of 0 – 3yr
* Applicants with personal-related experience are encouraged to apply
* Bilingual applicants are welcomed

**OUR MISSION**


Empowering families to reach their potential through early diagnosis and exceptional, innovative, interdisciplinary care.

**OUR VISION**


Transforming lives as a leader in innovative, integrated, and person-centered care.

**OUR VALUES**


Clinical excellence: Our services are evidence-based, outcome-driven, effective, and high quality.


Collaborative: Our interdisciplinary teams work together to provide the best care. We create a relationship-driven, inclusive community where everyone’s ideas are welcome.


Optimism and hope: We maintain a positive attitude and bring our clients hope.


Inclusive: We value diversity and seek equity. We serve all communities, including many that are often underserved and under-resourced.


Ethical: We act with integrity and transparency.

*It is the policy of Autism Care Partners to provide equal employment opportunities to all individuals. It is our policy to make all personnel decisions without discriminating based on race, color, creed, religion, sex, physical disability, mental disability, age, marital status, sexual orientation, citizenship status, national or ethnic origin, and any other protected status.*

*Autism Care Partners values all employees’ talents and supports an environment that is inclusive and respectful. All recruiting, hiring, training, promotion, compensation, and other employment-related programs are provided fairly to all persons on an equal opportunity basis.*

**Disclaimer** *The preceding job description has been designed to indicate the general nature and level of work necessary to adequately execute the job responsibilities. It is not designed to contain or be interpreted as a comprehensive inventory of all duties, responsibilities and qualifications required of employees assigned to this job*.

title: Anesthesia Technician
description:
**Role: Anesthesia Technician**

**Full Time**

**Shift: Day Mon-Fri 7a-3p**

**Salary Range: $52,472.36-$78,708.44**

**Position Summary :**

The Anesthesia Technician is responsible for the supply and processing needs of the Anesthesia Department and assists in the preparation of the Operating Rooms with necessary equipment and supplies for surgical procedures. This person works collaboratively with the Biomedical Engineering and Respiratory Therapy Departments and is an integral member of the Operating Room team with a commitment to efficiency and to providing safe, high quality care to the surgical patients. He or she performs other responsibilities as requested by the Nurse Manager, RN designee, or Director of Anesthesia or his designee.

**Responsibilities:**

* Understands and adheres to the WPH Performance Standards, Policies and Behaviors.
* Orders supplies for Anesthesia Department (storeroom items, direct purchases, pharmaceuticals).
* Restocks all ORs and L&D rooms with anesthesia equipment and supplies.
* Cleans anesthesia machines and carts on a regular or as-needed basis.
* Inventories medications on carts and in Anesthesia office, checks expiration dates, and removes and replaces outdated items.
* Restocks anesthesia supply room and maintains in an orderly environment.
* Oversees and documents scheduled maintenance and emergency repairs of anesthesia equipment.
* Transports nitrous oxide and oxygen tanks from Receiving Department.
* Transports blood specimens to Laboratory and blood products from Blood Bank to OR.
* Checks ORs between cases and resupplies missing items such as IV poles, ether screen holders, suction, arm boards and straps, warming blankets and machines, appropriate furniture, etc.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $58,808.00 - $77,612.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Medical Specialty:

* Anesthesiology

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Day shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* High school or equivalent (Preferred)

Experience:

* Required Prior hospital experience preferred: 3 years (Required)

Work Location: In person
